articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Spying runs in the family for Oleh Kolesnikov.
articles.title: Insight: How one man became a Ukrainian traitor and Russian spy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's main opposition party plans to "immediately" take steps to impeach acting president Han Duck-soo, the party's floor leader said on Tuesday.
articles.title: South Korean opposition plans to impeach acting president Han, floor leader says

articles.author: James Pomfret
articles.description: Hong Kong on Tuesday imposed bounties of HK$1 million ($128,728) on six more pro-democracy campaigners deemed to have violated national security laws, and revoked the passports of seven others, in a continuing security squeeze in the financial hub.
articles.title: Hong Kong offers bounties for six more democrats in security squeeze

articles.author: Maggie Fick, Ahmed Aboulenein
articles.description: Members of Donald Trump's presidential transition team are laying the groundwork for the United States to withdraw from the World Health Organization on the first day of his second term, according to a health law expert familiar with the discussions.
articles.title: Trump transition team plans immediate WHO withdrawal, expert says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel has instructed its diplomatic missions in Europe to try to get the Iran-backed Houthi rebel group in Yemen designated as a terrorist organisation.
articles.title: Israel asks diplomats to seek Houthis' listing as terrorists

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said on Tuesday he wanted to strengthen his country's alliance with the United States, as he pushed for as early as possible a meeting with U.S. President-elect Donald Trump.
articles.title: Japanese PM Ishiba: important to strengthen US-Japan alliance

articles.author: Andrew Osborn, Gleb Stolyarov
articles.description: A Russian cargo ship called Ursa Major sank in the Mediterranean Sea after an explosion ripped through its engine room and two of its crew are still missing, the Russian Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russian cargo ship sinks in Mediterranean after explosion, Russian Foreign Ministry says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian court has sentenced U.S. citizen Eugene Spector to 15 years in jail for espionage, Russia's RIA state news agency reported on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russian court jails U.S. citizen Spector for 15 years in espionage case, RIA says

articles.author: Khalid Abdelaziz, Ryan Mcneill, Nafisa Eltahir, Steve Stecklow, Lena Masri
articles.description: Sudan’s withdrawal from the IPC system could undermine humanitarian efforts to help millions of Sudanese suffering from extreme hunger.
articles.title: Exclusive: Sudan drops out of hunger-monitor system on eve of famine report

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Tim Reid
articles.description: Trump signals that he will pursue a foreign policy unbound by diplomatic niceties.
articles.title: Trump previews combative foreign policy with threats to Panama, Greenland
